dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale neighborhood. Perfectly manicured lawns. Early summer, flowers in full bloom.

dialogues.text: (getting nostalgic) Prom. What a wondrous night...

dialogues.text: Don’t forget your- Pete grabs the mail and shuts the door. INT. PETE’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Pete searches the mail and smiles when he sees a brochure that reads “Camp on Lake George!” He rushes upstairs.

dialogues.text: The kids are having fun in the back seat. Sam suddenly le over and kisses a surprised Chad. Kayla, in response, snuggles up to Dex, who dives in for raunchy tongue-flailing makeout. Kayla engages for a few seconds then pulls away and laughs nervously. Austin looks at Julie, what's going on here? Julie shrugs In the front seat, Seth is out of his tuxedo and is now sporting stained cargo shorts and a Garbage Pail Kids t- shirt. He zips down the partition.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Hey, my name is Seth. Shit’s gonna get epic up in here now that the ‘rents are in the rearview! The kids look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Put the partition back up... Seth.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: That’s cool! The kids laugh as the partition slides back up, then immediately slides back down. SETH (CONT’D) Before I vamanos, though, let me just say that I see some long faces back there. The kids look at each other again, what the fuck is with guy? SETH (CONT’D) I got just the thing to turn those frowns upside down. Who’s down for a little... (waves a baggie) Crystal? Made it myself. I’m no Heisenberg, but it’s good shit. Who’s down?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’d do a bag. Julie and Kayla are shocked.  22.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Julie and Kayla) What? I’m up for anything tonight. (quickly; to Seth) But no one else wants any, so no thanks. I can’t eat a whole bag by myself.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: I get it. No tweakers on board. How about we make it snow up in this bitch?! He waves another baggie filled with coke.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: We could use some beers later.

dialogues.speaker: CHAD
dialogues.text: And some energy drinks! Dex shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But mostly beer.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Beer? Seriously? (deflated) Yeah, I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pokes around. He opens the medicine cabinet. He appli Julie’s deodorant. Heaven. He picks up Julie’s toothbrush licks it. EXT. PETE’S BACKYARD - NIGHT Pete and Hunter sit around a FIRE PIT drinking beer. Hunt and Mitchell have tequila shots.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: We should all be proud of ourselves. We’ve raised three pretty great girls. The guys raise a glass and drink.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn't it crazy? In a few years, they’1l be off to college.  23.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Nuts. Hunter throws back a shot.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I’m sure going to miss Kayla around the house. The nice talks and the hugs. I’1l miss the hugs the most. Mitchell then downs an entire beer in a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys. What I just said there, that was bullshit. There are no hugs. I actually think Kayla’s embarrassed of me.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (lying) I doubt that.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Seriously? It’s pretty fucking obvious. Pete shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: She hasn’t called me “dad” in a year. She’s just calls me “hey.” As in, “hey, is that what you're wearing?” and “hey, ever heard of a courtesy flush?” Mitchell sighs, then throws back a shot.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s because I lost my job.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Are you getting any interviews?

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: No. And my resume is all over Monster. What else can I do? Pete shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I am an embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s bullshit, man.  24.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Yeah, look at you.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got... a lot of... good stuff going on.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Like...?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You're a great friend! Mitchell shrugs, that’s not doing it for him. Pete and Hu think hard...

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Look at those calves!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mentioned those earlier. The guys try, but can’t think of much else until...

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: You're awesome at sound effects! That honking horn sound? You could be the next Michael Winslow! Mitchell makes a bicycle honking noise with his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the one! So good. The guys muster a laugh. Mitchell cheers up.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I am pretty good at that. The guys nod.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You dudes wanna hear some of the new ones I’ve been working on?

dialogues.speaker: PETE HUNTER
dialogues.text: Maybe later. No. Mitchell smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ll get a few more logs for the fire. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (seizing the opportunity) Put another shrimp on the barbie!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Maybe stick with the sound effects. Accents aren't in your wheelhouse. Mitchell nods. He makes the honking sound as he walks awa

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: (quietly; to Pete) Why do we hang out with him? Pete smiles. Mitchell returns with a couple of logs.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You know, you’re not the only one with daughter problems, Mitchell. Julie’s bailing on our annual camping trip.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: That shit is normal, guys. Kids pull away from their parents. And you know those three girls. They’re attached at the hip. With the soccer and karate and whatever else. Pete and Mitchell share a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sam and I have an unspoken understanding. We give each other space and we’ll reconnect sometime during her mid to late-twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli opens Julie’s underwear drawer and his jaw drops as i he’s found the Lost Arc of the Covenant. He spots a bottl HAND LOTION on top of the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You’ve been out in the sun for a long time, Julie. Time to reapply. SPLOOSH, SPLOOSH. He pumps some lotion into one hand and picks up a pair of panties with the other. He notices the CAMPING BROCHURE in the drawer. He eyes it curiously.  26. EXT. PETE’S BACKYARD - NIGHT Mitchell is drunk and in a much better mood, playing drum the table with a couple of serving spoons.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Alright, this was a solid pre-game. Let’s hit Taste of Honey. Pete shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking pussies. Afraid of a strip club.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: We're not pussies. We’re parents.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: C'mon, dude, when’s the last time you had an entire night without Julie? Let’s pillage! Suddenly, SMOKE pours out from the garage door.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Uh, Pete! Pete frantically runs over and hits the garage door opene Smoke billows out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is filled with smoke. The guys start coughing. When the smoke clears, they find Eli sitting in Pete’s be up 2004 VOLVO STATION WAGON.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Mr. Harrington, gentlemen. INT. PETE’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Pete and Mitchell carry Eli, who looks fine, but distraug into the house. Hunter slaps him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What the hell?! I’m awake!

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: I know.  27.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Why are you trying to off yourself in my garage? Without a word, Eli hands Pete the CAMPING BROCHURE.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: This kid really hates camping.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Turn it over.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (reading) We, Kayla, Julie and Sam, who have known each other our whole lives, wish to this night one that we will never forget...

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: That’s sweet—

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: -Keep reading.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: .--and hereby swear that tonight, on the occasion of our first ever prom, we will all have... (strains to read) I can’t make out this word.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Sorry. It’s smudged from my tears. Sex. The word is sex. We all agree to have sex for the first time with our prom dates.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: What? WHAT??

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No, that... can’t be right. What is this?! Hunter grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: It’s some sort of contract.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It’s a fuck pact! The guys look around at each other, completely STUNNED.  28.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Is that... binding?

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PETE’S CAR —- MOMENTS LATER Pete drives the crappy Volvo wagon while on his cell. Mitchell rides shotgun; Hunter and Eli are in the back. T tension is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Straight to voicemail again. (frustrated) I’m sure this is some kind of mistake. I would have known about this.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I knew I shouldn’t have gotten her that HPV vaccine!

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: If this kid has sex with Sam, I can forget about getting with Debbie. And after all these years, that would be tragic.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: We're almost there. Let’s talk strategy.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Get in, spread out. Grab the kids off the dance floor, forbid them from having intercourse.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No! No! No! Check the dance floor last. Handicapped bathroom stalls first. Regular people stalls second.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Bathrooms? It’s their first time for chrissake! (to Pete, re: Eli ) Why the hell did you bring him?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Seriously. Pull over. Let’s dump his ass at the Arby's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s a good kid. (softly; to Mitchell) And I have rope and cutlery in my garage.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I’m just saying there probably won’t be any sex happening on the dance floor. But bathrooms are in play. Last week, my cousin Freddie sixty-nined with a lady in a port-o- potty behind Subway!

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: That couldn’t have been pretty. Meatball is the five dollar footlong this month. Pete reacts by giving it a bit more gas.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: The point is that teenagers will have sex anywhere they can. Eli notices Pete look at him in the rearview.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not me, though. Not with Julie. Our first time will be magical. I have it all planned. No jackhammering.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Stop talking, Eli.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: The loser may have a point. My first time was with Dawn Sadler in a sewer drain next to a rotting raccoon carcass. Mitchell shakes his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: (bragging) We did it four times. Eli nods, impressed. Pete hits the gas even harder. The w shakes as it hauls ass down residential streets.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tastefully decorated room is packed with horny PROM- GOERS. It’s a beautiful evening. Julie and Austin dance together and have a great time.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s going to be a special night. Austin nods and kisses her romantically. Sam sees Kayla looking over and responds by grinding on Chad, who's surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So do you think you're more of a Gale or a Peeta to my Katniss?

dialogues.speaker: CHAD
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re saying right now. Sam keeps grinding, but with a little less interest. Kayl tries to mimic Sam’s moves. Dex is into it, but is distra by the 50 YEAR OLD D.J., who looks terminally bored.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: I wish I had my tables. I would totally battle D.J. Fossil right now. I’m not feeling this guy’s beats at all. Kayla grinds hard. Dex takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: DEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are so slammin... Kayla raises a brow. Dex looks at his palm and sees smudg ink on it.

dialogues.speaker: DEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .+-Something with a “K.”

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: Riiiiight.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: We don’t have to talk so much. Kayla smiles. Dex nods, appreciatively.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys continue driving to the prom. Pete takes a hard turn. Eli slides across the back seat into Hunter. Eli shuffles back to his spot. He looks at Hunter for a momen

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Hey, can you see any reason you can see why Julie won’t give me the time of day?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Where should I start?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I mean, I know I’m not very macho. I'd ask my dad, but he left a while back. Hunter feels bad. He wasn’t expecting that response. Eli nods.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Maybe I could... give you some tips.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You'd do that?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Why not? You kinda remind me of the dorks I used to beat up in school.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Cool. I’m a romantic, so I’m good there. But if it wasn’t for porn, I'd know nothing about sex.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Here’s something: don’t try to kill yourself in a girl’s house. For most of them, complete turnoff.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe you just need to relax a bit. Be a kid, cut loose. Do something unexpected. Chicks like bad boys.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Bad boys, huh? Hunter nods. Eli loosens his tie, undoes his top button a turns to Hunter.  32.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Well, baby steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegant facility lit with stunning landscape lighting. Pete’s car flies like a bucking bronco over a speed bump! The car SCREECHES to a halt and the guys hurry to the doo LOUD HIP-HOP MUSIC PUMPS from inside.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Sounds like it’s popping off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballroom is ALMOST EMPTY - a handful of LESS ATTRACTI PROM-GOERS and a pair of HANDSY CHAPERONES remain. The Chaperones make out while kids watch. Some STRAGGLER dance; others including a BOY WITH HORRIBLE ACNE and a KI A WHEELCHAIR sit alone at tables, no doubt debating the merits of suicide. The guys meet at the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: No, all the bathrooms are empty.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Wow. Is this the prom for some kind of special school?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No, we're in the right place. The cool kids are gone. The only people left are the drama fags and the regular fags.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (heartfelt) Poor bastards... where to next?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Austin’s house.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: 5721 Haverford Drive.  33.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: That's where the kids were going after the prom.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Let’s go now. This shit might be contagious. Pete, feeling bad for the Kids, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It gets better!! The Boy With Horrible Acne gives Pete a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 7-11
dialogues.text: Seth talks with Austin, Dex and Chad outside the limo.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Hundred bucks should do it.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: (getting in Seth’s face) For a case of Bud?! I'll rip your head off- Austin puts out a hand, calming Dex.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: (pleading with Seth) We’re in high school. We don’t have that kind of cash. Come on, Seth.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Don’t “come on” me. The guys laugh. Seth is embarrassed, but brushes it off. SETH (CONT’D) Look, I’ve got two strikes. I could get life for making this purchase. So if you want those Buds, daddy’s gonna need a hundy. Dex looks like he wants to strangle Seth. SETH (CONT’D) Do you wanna keep this party rolling or not? Because if not, maybe I should be dropping these fine young ladies off at home.  34. Austin, Dex and Chad share a look, then reach into their wallets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys fly down a residential street.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: It’s a left here, Pete. (as they pass the turn) Left!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Meadow Lane is faster.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: No, it’s slower with all of the stop signs. You just cost us five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how many times a teenage boy can ejaculate in five minutes?! Pete blows a stop sign and a SIREN wails!

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Nice work, Pete.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I knew we shouldn’t have gone this way! Did I call it? Did I?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You called it.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Totally called it! Pete pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re drunk. And we are totally screwed.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m not drunk. I had a couple of beers.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Tell them you’ve had nothing. Zero beers. Deny, deny, deny.  35.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna lie. I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I have some gum, Mr. H.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I do, too.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I don’t need it.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Act casually and breathe through your noses. Mitchell grabs his and Eli’s gum and shoves it in Pete’s mouth. A young Hispanic cop, OFFICER HERNANDEZ, shines hi flashlight into the car and leans in.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Good evening, gentlemen. Pete works hard to chew a GIANT WAD OF GUM.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Officer. The guys all nod hello. Pete hands him his license and registration. Hernandez looks at the documents, then into car and sees Mitchell and Eli conspicuously tight-lipped.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Have you gentlemen been drinking tonight?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (mouth still full) I had a couple beers earlier. But as you can see, I’m perfectly fine now. So if you don’t mind, just write me a ticket and we’ll be on our way. We’re in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Oh, is that right? Pete nods and continues chewing. Hernandez looks at his f veteran partner, OFFICER DONOHUE, who shakes his head in disgust. Hernandez gives Pete a hard look. HERNANDEZ (CONT’D) Who's the kid?  36.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It’s okay, officer. This isn’t a Sandusky situation. That did not allay Hernandez’s concerns.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Sir, I’m going to ask you to step out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Why? Hernandez stares at Pete for a moment and puts his hand o his holster.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Because I fucking said so. Hernandez looks at Donohue, who gives him a thumbs up. Pe looks at the guys, worried. He spits out the gum and gets of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter, Mitchell and Eli are all looking out the window o the car as Pete is being given a Breathalyzer test.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Blow, blow, blow, keep blowing! Hernandez looks at the test. Pete blows a .06, below the legal limit. Donohue, who has a snarling GERMAN SHEPHERD his side, looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (to the guys) Point oh six! The guys celebrate in the car - high fives all around. Th Cops don’t look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, thank you officers. Sincerely. You know, I thought about being a cop myself, but then

dialogues.speaker: I-
dialogues.text: (regretting it as the words come out) -got into college.  37. Donohue turns to Hernandez. They both look pissed.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. College boy, huh? Color us impressed.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No, that came out wrong. I just-

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: You know, I haven’t calibrated the Breathalyzer recently. We better conduct a field sobriety test.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Guys, please, don’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Nah, let’s just take him in. Get a blood test, just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Let's do the field sobriety test, okay? What do you need me to do?

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: How about some running in place?

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, let’s see some of that. The Cops share a smirk. Grizzly barks at Pete as he runs place. INT. PETE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER Mitchell, Hunter and Eli sit in the car.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on out there? REVEAL Pete doing squat thrusts.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: We're losing valuable time while Pete’s blasting his quads!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: This is like a horror movie. It’s the Prom Night Hymen Massacre. Eli checks his cell phone, then yells out the window:  38.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not for nothing, Mr. Harrington, but Austin’s house has five bedrooms. I Zillowed it! ON PETE, who shakes his head in frustration and stops the squat thrusts.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Alright, guys. I think we’re done here. I’m sober and pretty sweaty. Suddenly, Donohue takes a defensive stance and quickly mo his right hip away from Pete.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: Whoa, hey, buddy! Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What? Pete hasn’t moved and looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: (to Hernandez) You see this guy just make a move for my sidearm?!

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: (catching on) Oh, yeah! Totally saw that! Your sidearm. He made a move.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: College boy’s going to matriculate downtown. I’1l load Grizzly. You cuff his ass! Hernandez grabs Pete as Donohue walks the dog to the Crui After a beat of hesitation, Pete SHOVES HERNANDEZ TO THE GROUND and sprints to his car!

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: We’ve got a runner!!! SCREECH!!! Donohue turns to see that Pete has peeled out!

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: Holy fuck! Hernandez gets up. He and Donohue look dazed, not knowing to respond. After a beat, they hop in the Cruiser and tak off after the guys.  39. INT. PETE’S CAR - CONTINUOUS The guys are STUNNED as Pete flies down the road.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: We were going to be there all night! We have very little time to find the girls.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: He’s right, they were fucking with him! I’ve never done the running man during a sobriety check.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: They have your license! We’re all going to jail!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I know, but what choice did I have?! Pete spots the Cruiser in his rear view, lights flashing sirens blaring. Pete cranks the wheel hard and turns.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Pull over! Marcie’s never gonna let me hang out with you guys again!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: If anyone survives, tell Julie I loved her and I will live in her room when I’m a ghost! Pete makes another sharp turn.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m not pulling over. If any of you want out, I’1l slow down and you can jump.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Then I don’t get to bang Debbie and the dream dies. Fuck that! Hunter starts pounding the ceiling of the car with his ha

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yeah, keep hope alive!  40. Eli starts banging the ceiling, too. Mitchell, somewhat m reluctantly, joins in. Pete makes a series of hard turns, then pulls into a random driveway and kills the lights.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Get down! Everyone ducks in the car and a moment later, the police cruiser flies by down the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops look down each street as they drive by.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Donohue punches the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAYLA AND DEX’S HOTEL ROOM - CONTINUOUS Mitchell runs into the room!

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! Kayla quickly covers herself, mascara running down her fa with tears. Mitchell grabs Dex by the throat. Dex throws a punch and Mitchell blocks it. Mitchell unlea a devastating uppercut Blood explodes across Dex’s face a goes to the floor. Dex loses a front tooth. Dex groans as he rolls around on the floor. Kayla jumps i her father’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Are you okay?! She nods, a tear streaming down her face.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this guy?!

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: That’s my daddy, asshole! Mitchell is taken aback by her calling him daddy.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, dad.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: It’s okay, baby. Let’s get out of here. Kayla kicks Dex in the gut on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Sam sit on a bench near the lobby. She smiles at He realizes how pretty she is.  102.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m so embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Don’t be. We’re kids. We’re supposed to make mistakes. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you wanna talk about it, I’m here for you. He reaches out and strokes her arm gently, but in a firm She Eli Sam Sam

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I felt so much pressure because my friends are in such a rush to do everything. It was a mistake. I wasn’t ready to go all the way.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I totally get it. You’1l know when you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m more comfortable now. With you. looks at him, this is his window.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You've had a lot to drink tonight. I don’t want to take advantage.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I puked four times. I’m good now. considers the offer.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: As much as it turns me on to hear that, you said yourself, you’re not ready. looks disappointed. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think your mouth is ready? smiles.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete and Maya get to Julie’s room and Pete hesitates. He takes a deep breath and raises his hand to knock on the d He lingers, then drops his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’ve had a hard time moving on from my wife. Julie will be going to college soon and I’1l be alone. Maya puts his hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now... I’m not even sure I’m doing this for Julie. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here before I change my mind. Maya nods and slips her arms through Pete’s. They walk aw

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about that cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (re: her hooker outfit) Maybe after a change of clothes? Pete smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter walks toward the car as Eli and Sam walk out from row of bushes. Eli looks elated... and spent.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: And the season is right, so we'll be able to hear the whales serenading us.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can’t wait! (beat) Bring your Serenity BluRay. Eli beams.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Sweetheart!  104.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh, hey dad. Hunter runs over and grabs Sam and to her surprise, hugs He wipes tears from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm fine, dad. Nothing happened. Hunter pumps a fist.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I haven’t been a better dad. I should have known you were going through a tough time with your friends.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: No, it’s not. I haven’t been involved enough in your life and you're the most important thing in the world to me. Sam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it’s not too late. I’m gonna make it up to you. Okay, Sammy?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (emotional) I'd like that, dad. They hug again. Sam takes Eli’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: What’s that about?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You were right. I can move on. I love her, Hunter. Hunter takes a moment, then nods. Sam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and Kayla walk out of the Hotel.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You know, Kayla. I know you’re embarrassed of me. And I don’t blame you. I’m sure it’s not easy having a dad who’s unemployed.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You’re unemployed?

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (stunned) Yeah. Going on eight months. (beat) If you didn’t know, why are so embarrassed of me?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I’m a teenager. I have my own issues. If it makes you feel any better, you’re no more or less embarrassing than anyone else’s dad.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Thanks, Peanut. That means a lot. They approach the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Whose minivan?

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: We had to steal it to ditch the cops. I’1ll explain later. Or not. Kayla smiles, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (sotto) Bad. Ass. Kayla climbs into the car and hugs Sam.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I was such a bitch to you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Friends again? Sam nods. Kayla notices Eli who smiles and nods to her.  106.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He’s with me.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Cool. Pete and Maya walk over to the guys. Suddenly, the POLICE CRUISER flies into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (resigned) We knew this was gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (hugging Kayla) It was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: (nods ) Time to pay the piper. The cops hop out with their guns drawn!

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: On the ground, assholes!! The guys put their hands up. Hernandez handcuffs the dads Eli. Suddenly, Dex comes stumbling out by the lobby. Dono spots him.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poindexter? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Poindexter?! Kayla laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on? (re: his bloody face) What happened to you, son?  107. Dex doesn’t know what to say. He looks at the kids, then turns to Donohue.

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault! She signed a pact!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donohue talks with Mitchell, Pete and Hunter as Hernandez uncuffs them.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: We'll pay for all of the damages. Thanks for not taking us in.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: Thank you for not pressing charges. I promise he will not get a free pass on this. ON KAYLA AND SAM... --- who look at Eli, still handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I think I get why you’re into Eli. He’s kind of a bad boy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think he might be. ON DONOHUE... ++. who grabs Dex by the ear and drags him to the police Dex now looks like the large boy he still is.

dialogues.speaker: DONOHUE
dialogues.text: Get in the car right now... And no turntables for a month!

dialogues.speaker: DEX
dialogues.text: But dad!! Donohue slams the car door. He and Hernandez get in. Griz licks and slobbers on Dex’s face. He looks miserable as t drive off. ON PETE... ... who turns to Hunter, Mitchell and Eli.  108.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What a night, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Awful.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Best night of my life.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It was something, alright. Hunter begins to laugh hard. They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Mitchell has two more daughters! Everyone laughs but Mitchell. Maya pulls up in her car.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’ll see you guys later. Hunter, Mitchell and Eli nod to him as Pete climbs into t car. Hunter hops in the minivan driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Now how about that McFlurry! The minivan drives across the hotel parking lot. Its fron bumper drags, then falls off as the minivan peels out ont the street. INT. PETE’S HOUSE - LATE NIGHT The front door opens and Julie walks in quietly. A LOUD N comes from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Dad? She walks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. where she finds Pete standing on the opposite side of island.  109.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetheart. How was your night?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It was... amazing. Pete nods, knowing far more than he should about her nigh

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (sincerely) I’m glad.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me go.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (recognizing the double meaning) It wasn’t easy...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know. I’m glad you’re my dad. Pete smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm tired. I’m gonna head up to bed. Pete nods. Julie stops and turns back to Pete.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about the first week in August? Pete looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For our camping trip?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What about Austin and your friends?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I wanna spend some time with you.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Sounds perfect.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I love you, dad.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I love you, too, sweetheart.  110. Julie leans across the island, gives him a kiss and walks of the kitchen. It’s a nice moment as he stands there, thinking. A REVERSE SHOT REVEALS Pete’s BARE ASS. Maya is crouched naked next to him. They start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was close.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I'll get going.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No. Stay. I want to introduce you two tomorrow. Maya smiles as we...
